definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
to speak one's mind/to speak candidly (idiom)

sentences.english: To state outright and dare to remonstrate were his conduct of politics .
sentences.chinese: 直言敢谏是他从政品行的主要特点。

sentences.english: Please tell me your opinion frankly.
Those are blunt, unyielding admonitions that ring in my head every day.
sentences.chinese: 那些直言不讳的忠告每天都在我头脑中响起。

sentences.english: I'll come right out and say it. This is the only legitimate excuse I can think of.
sentences.chinese: 恕我直言，这是我认为唯一的正当理由。

sentences.english: This seems to be a non-issue IMHO.
sentences.chinese: 恕我直言，这个不成问题。

sentences.english: 'Ask your pardon, sir, you would be very wrong, ' quoth Silver.
sentences.chinese: 请恕我直言，先生，那样你就大错特错了。

sentences.english: It is also establishing a straight-talking culture inside the company.
sentences.chinese: 还在公司内部建立直言文化。

sentences.english: The Street and media responded well to her bluntness.
sentences.chinese: 业内和媒体对于她的直言不讳反应良好。

sentences.english: With all due respect, I think there are some facts you have not considered.
sentences.chinese: 恕我直言，我想你忽略了一些事实。

sentences.english: He is free with his advice to his pupils.
sentences.chinese: 他直言无隐地向学生提出忠告。

sentences.english: Excuse me (for calling a spade a spade), but you're completely wrong.
No, if I may be so blunt.
sentences.chinese: 恕我直言，我不这样认为。

sentences.english: But to be perfectly frank, we doubt that Lu herself is above Blue vs. Green political considerations.
sentences.chinese: 但是，容我们直言，吕恐怕也未必能够完全超越蓝绿。

sentences.english: Admonitionliang Bute dare say, by general recognition.
sentences.chinese: 良弼直言敢谏，深受将军赏识。

sentences.english: The EC is not paid by Pakistan, so I can be outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 由于巴基斯坦不向欧共体交钱，所以我可以直言不讳。

sentences.english: Okajima is equally outspoken about his struggles.
sentences.chinese: 冈岛对于他的挣扎也是同样直言。

definition: to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
to express/to show/to say/to state/to indicate/to mean
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to refer to/to speak about/to talk about
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
